head.title: Political Briefing; Indiana Gas-Tax Suspension Arouses Political Skepticism

hedline.hl1: Political Briefing; Indiana Gas-Tax Suspension Arouses Political Skepticism

abstract.p: Gov Frank O'Bannon of Indiana has used emergency provision in state law to suspend state's gas tax for two months; motorists applaud, but some Republican officials and legislators note O'Bannon, a Democrat, is up for re-election; photo (S)

block.p: While many state and federal officials and investigators wring their hands and wonder what to do about surging gas prices, Gov. Frank O'Bannon of Indiana has acted.

Last week, using an emergency provision in Indiana law, Mr. O'Bannon, a Democrat, suspended the state's gas tax for two months, a move that will cut up to 10 cents off the price of a gallon of gasoline, now well over $2 in many places in Indiana and elsewhere in the Midwest.
While many state and federal officials and investigators wring their hands and wonder what to do about surging gas prices, Gov. Frank O'Bannon of Indiana has acted.

Last week, using an emergency provision in Indiana law, Mr. O'Bannon, a Democrat, suspended the state's gas tax for two months, a move that will cut up to 10 cents off the price of a gallon of gasoline, now well over $2 in many places in Indiana and elsewhere in the Midwest.
''Hoosiers can't afford to wait on federal and state investigators to tell us why the Midwest is being hit so hard,'' Mr. O'Bannon said.
At the pump, many motorists roundly applauded the governor.

But some Republican officials and legislators saw politics, not just dollar signs, in Mr. O'Bannon's move, noting that he is up for re-election and that he chose to announce the tax suspension against the photogenic backdrop of a busy Indianapolis gas station. They argued that the cut would unbalance the state budget and save the average motorist less than $2 per tank at the pump.
''It's politics, a political year,'' said Senator Lawrence Borst of Greenwood, chairman of the Senate Finance Committee.
The governor's campaign manager, Tom New, had a one word response for that: ''Phooey.''
